playbook_text:
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.

buses_3_buy_bus_ticket
- delta1: Return tool call objects directly, not string representations in brackets

reflection.reasoning: The model correctly identified the food item and modification request but wrapped the tool call in XML tags instead of returning the structured object directly.
reflection.error_identification: Model output XML string instead of structured tool call object, causing AST decoder failure.
reflection.root_cause_analysis: The model treated the tool call as a string to be formatted in XML rather than returning the actual function call object.
reflection.correct_approach: Return the change_food function call as a structured object with food_item and modification_request parameters directly.
reflection.key_insight: Tool calls must be returned as structured objects, not XML-formatted strings, even when XML formatting is specified for other parts of the response.

messages.content: You are the ACE Curator. Convert reflections into crisp playbook operations per tool group. Prefer modifying existing bullets when possible, but keep different concepts separate. Only generalize when the evaluation summary indicates a systemic issue, but otherwise don't overgeneralize bullet points. Generally respect the BFCL evaluation but think about what you would want to tell the model in order for it to improve in the many cases it may face in the future.keep the playbook unchanged on successes unless an existing entry now conflicts with verified behaviour. Functional parity with the checker matters more than superficial differences . Output JSON.

Sample ID: format_sensitivity_2016:ret_fmt=verbose_xml&tool_call_tag=True&func_doc_fmt=json&prompt_fmt=plaintext&style=classic:live_simple_20-4-0
Tool groups: change_food

Existing playbook:
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.

buses_3_buy_bus_ticket
- delta1: Return tool call objects directly, not string representations in brackets

Evaluation summary:
BFCL evaluation FAILED for format_sensitivity_2016:ret_fmt=verbose_xml&tool_call_tag=True&func_doc_fmt=json&prompt_fmt=plaintext&style=classic:live_simple_20-4-0 (format_sensitivity).
Error type: ast_decoder:decoder_failed
Error message: Invalid syntax. Failed to decode AST. 'str' object has no attribute 'keys'

Tool-call differences:
Turn 0: missing change_food; extra <TOOLCALL><functions><function name="change_food"><params><param name="food_item" value="burger" type="string"/><param name="modification_request" value="no onions,extra cheese" type="string"/></params></function></functions></TOOLCALL>

Ground truth reference:
Focus on achieving the checker-validated tool effects.

Reflection:
{
  "reasoning": "The model correctly identified the food item and modification request but wrapped the tool call in XML tags instead of returning the structured object directly.",
  "error_identification": "Model output XML string instead of structured tool call object, causing AST decoder failure.",
  "root_cause_analysis": "The model treated the tool call as a string to be formatted in XML rather than returning the actual function call object.",
  "correct_approach": "Return the change_food function call as a structured object with food_item and modification_request parameters directly.",
  "key_insight": "Tool calls must be returned as structured objects, not XML-formatted strings, even when XML formatting is specified for other parts of the response."
}

Guidance:
- If the evaluation PASSED, many cases you would return an empty operation list. Propose removals or updates when the current playbook conflicts with the verified behaviour as to need to be updated.
- If the evaluation FAILED, add, modify, or remove bullets narrowly targeted to the failure described in the summary/details.
- Keep updates scoped to the triggering context unless the pattern is clearly systemic.
- Keep content under 160 characters. Return an empty list when no update is needed.

Return JSON with keys "reasoning" (<=2 sentences) and "operations".
Each operation must be one of:
  {"type": "ADD", "section": "<tool_group>", "content": "<short bullet>"}
  {"type": "MODIFY", "section": "<tool_group>", "ID": "<existing id>", "content": "<short bullet>"}
  {"type": "REMOVE", "section": "<tool_group>", "ID": "<existing id>"}
